reviews.review_msg: I strongly advise you to avoid Neil. He's checked out during class time and it's clear that he doesn't give a flying raccoon about learning. What makes this course easy is that he grades very forgivingly to compensate for his lack of teaching. He likes to explain things once and never go back to it. He also uses iClicker. You have been warned.

Not very helpful in lectures, pretty much just reads off the slides that are prepared for him. Would recommend taking this class in Burnaby with another prof  or just wait until spring semester to take the class with someone else
Overall lazy teacher. Simply rereads lectures slides but does help if asked.
Good at explaining. If you stick around after everyone else leaves, or come before class, he is more than willing to help you with anything, including random questions about physics.

Horrible prof does not even bother teaching just sits there and looks at stuff on google plus leaves the entitre course to the students alongwith a ton of homework daily. Whatever you do NEVER take a class with him.

PLEASE do not take physics with this prof, especially if you're first year. i was not a physics major and found this class *excruciating*. bad lectures, useless help (although it is available) and tons of homework. self-directed class. drop if you have him!

if you plan on being a physics major, you might make it through this class. if you're taking it to fufill a lower division pre-req for a diff degree, DONT TAKE THIS WITH HIM. espec. if you're first year. exams ARE fair but you must keep up with homework (there's a lot!) lectures are horrible. hard to pay attention if you don't love physics.

Not the greatest teacher. Relies on you teaching yourself. The entire course is labs, which you don't learn anything from. Goes way to slow on stuff you know already, then way too fast through complicated stuff.
Very good teacher!
if you aren't naturally good at physics, then don't take him...cuz he won't teach you much

He's not a bad prof. He loves to entertain students. However, we are not in PNE, right? Midterms are not that hard, quite fair [at least one suprising question inside though]. Final is hard [since he asked a lot from the last chapters of the book] To sum up, he's good for grade/fun but not for learning physics that much...
There is alot of homework, and is pretty heavy work load. shes not too bad in my experience. Just so much work holy gee moly, but her notes are fine etc.

You basically teach yourself through FlipItPhysics. Gives a ridiculous amount of online homework. The entire class is basically a group work lab with really lame experiments. She only lectures for the first 20ish minutes of class then typically spends the rest of the time on Twitter letting the TAs do all the work.

Prof does not explain things during the class and expects students to study on their own. There is no learning done in her class due to the extremely repetative activity guides. The tests are much harder than the material covered. Would NOT reccomend. Had waaayyy better physics teachers in high school.
Wouldn't recommend her. Thinks she is the best teacher, but her content is scattered and doesn't follow any good material. Too many assignments that are a burden.

Very good professor. Explained material well, and responded well when questions were asked and ensured you understood the material. Do some practice questions to be comfortable with all the material and you'll do fine on her exams.
Yeah just avoid him
If  ur an international student,do not take his course,and you should learn all the things by youself before tests,his class offer 0 help,and moody,that's the best word to describe peter.

Even though this is a studio class so its expected that you should know the basics for some of the topics, the problem is that the textbook he instructs us to read is a level above our current knowledge. The questions on ExpertTA is based on the content in the textbook. Some of the questions are impossible to solve unless you took MATH152

This dude is not cool at all y'all. He doesn't teach anything and expects you to be Einstein or Newton or sth. You must do everything by yourself and you'll lose interest in Physics after taking his course.

This professor is so bad. He never teaches us anything during class, and never does any exersices with us but expects us to be able to do them in. the midterms. Everytime he starts talking all he does is confuse us even more. I had to learn all the topics by myself and I know of others who had to do the same. If you can, avoid taking PHYS with him.
GOOD LUCK to whoever gets the pleasure of being taught by him. Basically learner all the material myself, just glad my tuition money is getting put good use.

If you get him in an online class good luck, he doesn't teach the physics himself and basically only does activities in class (which often don't relate to the physics that you have to learn on your own through FlipItPhysics) No actual lectures happened in this class so if you can't learn on your own good luck...
Good thing is hes funny. Thats the only thing I can leave with positive feedback

Doesn't teaches anything and expects you to learn by yourself. Treats university students like high school students. Expects you to buy book (which needs to be new, not used) and other materials which cost a lot. Thinks he is funny with his jokes but he is actually not.
Doesn't really teach the course syllabus and expects you to learn everything on your own.

Professor expects you to learn the course yourself, through all the textbooks you have to buy. Online reading and homework, lots of class work, 1% of the time professor teaching. Biggest problem is that he is the only professor for the course.
too much work and just waste my time on the boring experiments
He is the worst teacher in the world
I just want to say he is really bad
He reuqired us using the new books that will be more than 300$ and as for his teaching, he just in his office and let us read the book without teaching. I wont take his cource agian his really suck.
He is my favourite prof forever.  He is funny , so make class very interesting .  Very enjoy his class.  If u don't want ur life boring,  Just take his courses.
Don't give a clear mission to student
Great Guy. Great at marking. Gives you clues to the answers rather than telling you exactly what it is. Looking forward to take another course with him!
The most hilarious physics prof in the entire Uni.

Explains concepts very well and made the material easy to understand (for me, at least). Love the anecdotes he told throughout the semester. Amusing. The final exam had the same questions from our midterms!
Excellent Prof.  Just be sure to take notes during class. Trust me they are extremely helpful during exams.

I took phys 140 in fall 24' and it was definitely a roller coaster to say the least. there are few lectures, but the course is mainly taught through reading the textbook before classtime and labs during classtime. it too a very long time to change my way of learning to fit the structure of the class, but overall, Daria is an amazing prof
Im not the biggest fan of the experimental learning type classes. But, it's a lot of fun when you understand everything.

Daria is great at teaching, however, I did not like the style of the class being that everything is a group activity with a minimal lecture, meaning that you had to figure out most things on your own. The class is not hard if you've taken Physics 100, but I would have preferred more lectures than activities. ExpertTA homework is very tedious.

Dr. A is a nice and laid-back professor. Before each class, you must read the textbook and write a quiz on the material. Then in class, you perform a lab. Dr A will do a summary of the textbook material before the lab but you're expected to read the textbook (most people don't). Not a hard course if you do things on time and practice the material.

Every class is a mini-lab and the goal is to discover the solution yourself. Of course there's TAs and her ready to help. If you ever have a question ask her and she'll explain it one-on-one much better than a lecture in my experience. Easy on grading, focused on your learning - exactly the kind of professor SFU needs more of!
I used to love Physics until I met her.

She cares about her students and isn't strict with due dates. Classes themselves were not bad, some simple experiments and a short informal report...but midterms were a disaster. The questions are completely different from the ones she gives you in class, and she doesn't give you too many to begin with. The textbook isn't very helpful either.

Dr. Sabine was one of the best Prof I had. Dr. Sabine really responds to your questions and your doubts and also you can ask for an appointment outside of the class in addition to office hours if there are any other questions. Assignments are beneficial and help you to absorb the concept better.

An amazing professor who can explain very well and clarifies all doubts that I had. If you can I recommend to take her class. She is really good with the basics and can surely build a good foundation for physics.

I would like to say that if you take Sabine Betts as your teacher in this course, do finish the homework IN TIME. I did not do the homework in time, so my marks were cut heavily. The way she taught my class was fine and engaging. He grading scheme is not that tough. If you ask her any questions, she would answer them to the best of her ability.
Have a look at one of the books she recommends and it is an A+.
